div.p: Coursematerial consisting of CD-rom and a book.
Topic: undergraduate Algebra, first and second year university Algebra, i.e, Groups, Rings and Fields.

RIACA,
Research Institute for Applications of Computer Algebra,
Eindhoven University of Technology.
Authors are Arjeh Cohen, Hans Cuypers, Hans Sterk.

ul.li: Construct a new learning process with the help of modern means and IC-technology
Support for teachers. Many examples can be used during lectures.

div.b: How did we try to realize our goals?.

ul.li:
Presentation of the course via a webbrowser.
(Non linear presentation, search and navigation tools)

Use of computer algebra system to perform calculations.
(`Infinitely' many examples, experiments by students, checking of exercises.)

Annimations.
(Examples that attract attention, motivate and explain.)

Multiple choice tests and open exercises with hints and examples.
(The student has possibilities to check his/her understanding.)

div.p: The second version of Algebra Interactive! will be much more flexible and dynamic by the use of OpenMath technology.

ul.li: All mathematics will be in OpenMath
The source files will be in OMDoc, (a form of XML)
Sources will be in a Mathematical database
Use of OpenMath server to connect to several back engines, like GAP, CoCoA, Mathematica.

Better search facilities
OpenMath enables searches on formulas

One source many presentations.
Using XSL style sheets one can produce different output formats:
LaTeX for a printed document, HTML for a web document, ...

One source many documents.
Using XSL style sheets one can produce different types of contents:
Courses tailored for the needs of the students,
Sheets for presentation in class,
Reference book for students

Better and combined use of the various back engines
Even in a basic course on Algebra on Groups, Rings and Fields there is the need of several CAS.
